title: Criterion 1
stimulusHtml:
1 point

Selects and completely identifies an artwork from Africa, the Indigenous Americas, or the Pacific that was created and performed to offer humans access to supernatural, political, and/or social power.

Identifying a work of art includes title or designation, name of the artist and/or culture of origin, date of creation, and materials. At least two accurate identifiers must be given for the point to be earned. If the work appears on the list provided, two accurate identifiers NOT included on the list must be given for the point to be earned.
descriptions:
Selects and completely identifies an artwork from Africa, the Indigenous Americas, or the Pacific that was created and performed to offer humans access to supernatural, political, and/or social power.

Identifying a work of art includes title or designation, name of the artist and/or culture of origin, date of creation, and materials. At least two accurate identifiers must be given for the point to be earned. If the work appears on the list provided, two accurate identifiers NOT included on the list must be given for the point to be earned.

title: Criterion 2
stimulusHtml:
1 point

Accurately identifies the materials and/or symbolism in the artwork that offer humans access to power.
descriptions: Accurately identifies the materials and/or symbolism in the artwork that offer humans access to power.

title: Criterion 3
stimulusHtml:
1 point

Accurately describes the type of power those materials and/or symbolism are intended to activate.
descriptions: Accurately describes the type of power those materials and/or symbolism are intended to activate.

title: Criterion 4
stimulusHtml:
1 point

Accurately describes the performance that activates that power.
descriptions: Accurately describes the performance that activates that power.

title: Criterion 5
stimulusHtml:
0-2 points

Accurately explains how cultural beliefs support the practices associated with the artwork that offer humans access to power.

The first point is earned for accurately describing two or more cultural beliefs that support the practices associated with the artwork that offer humans access to power.

The second point is earned for accurately explaining how two or more cultural beliefs support the practices associated with the art work that offer humans access to power.
descriptions:
Accurately explains how cultural beliefs support the practices associated with the artwork that offer humans access to power.

The first point is earned for accurately describing two or more cultural beliefs that support the practices associated with the artwork that offer humans access to power.

The second point is earned for accurately explaining how two or more cultural beliefs support the practices associated with the art work that offer humans access to power.

Accurately explains how cultural beliefs support the practices associated with the artwork that offer humans access to power.

The first point is earned for accurately describing two or more cultural beliefs that support the practices associated with the artwork that offer humans access to power.

The second point is earned for accurately explaining how two or more cultural beliefs support the practices associated with the art work that offer humans access to power.

title: Criterion 6
stimulusHtml:
1 point

Accurately explains the response or effect that the performance of this work was intended to elicit.
descriptions: Accurately explains the response or effect that the performance of this work was intended to elicit.
